meanings.definition: To make fun of or mock someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She ridicules her brother's jokes playfully.
meanings.sent2: The comedian ridicules the politician's speech in his show.
meanings.sent3: The children ridiculed the cat's attempt to catch a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: His friends ridiculed his dance moves, comparing them to a robot malfunctioning.
meanings.sent5: The teacher ridicules the incorrect answers to help students learn from their mistakes.

meanings.definition: The act of mocking or making fun of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His ridicules of the teacher's outfit were not appreciated.
meanings.sent2: The movie included several ridicules of popular celebrities.
meanings.sent3: The group's ridicules of each other's drawings turned into a laughter-filled art class.
meanings.sent4: Her ridicules of the new fashion trend were met with raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The magazine's ridicules of the latest technology left readers questioning their own devices.
